text: “Every tide bends to those who build the shore.”
The clang of his hammer marks both construction and destruction — and always conquest.
With this, a mere gesture can bring fleets to heel — or raise the storm.
With hammer in hand, Hafskael builds ports, smashes skulls, and commands the sea.
A master shipwright and war-priest, he brings divine fury and naval might in equal measure.
When this banner flies, ships do not sink — and men do not flee.
Harbinger of storms and stone, Hafskael carves empires from both seawater and granite.
hafskael's devotion to Olric is as fiery as his Norse heritage driven lust for plunder and battle.
Storm-builder. Hull-mender. Breaker of men and wood alike.

Where lesser jarls seek plunder, Hafskael builds legacies. Through port, pier, and prow, he has turned a meagre coastal village into a maritime superpower. With his enchanted hammer — a relic said to be forged in the furnace of a drowned god — he brings the might of the sea to every battle. Longships led by Hafskael strike like waves upon a cliff, relentless and crushing.
A brutal downward strike infused with maritime force, causing tremors and shattering formations like a breaking wave.
With a bellow and a runed strike against the longship’s prow, Hafskael breathes life back into the timber and steel.
Local Recruitment duration: %+n turn for all Marauder Champion and Huscarl units
The prow is sharpened like a ram, its wheels reinforced with anchor-flukes — built to split ranks like reefs split hulls.

Simple in make, brutal in purpose. Dockiron bears no ornate sigils or runes — only the scars of years spent raising piers and collapsing skulls. Once a tool for driving mooring stakes into hard stone, its dense weight and unforgiving face now serve Hafskael on the battlefield. Blood cakes the haft where pitch once clung, and every impact rings with the sound of breaking boards... or bones.
The prow is sharpened like a ram, its wheels reinforced with anchor-flukes — built to split ranks like reefs split hulls.

This humble, sea-worn figurehead of a galloping steed was once mounted beneath the prow of the Sternwolf, a legendary longship. Now worn as a talisman by Hafskael, it carries the blessing of the sea gods and the ancestral strength of the Bjornling fleet. It still smells faintly of salt, pitch, and a battle long past.
Passive Ability: "Hrimross's Charm" for Longship units
Global recruitment duration: %+n turn for Longship units
Local recruitment duration: %+n turn for Longship units
A wooden talisman to ward the ship, the warrior, and the soul.
Jarl Hafskael is recruited as a Legendary Hero
Passive Ability: "Eye of the Longfather" for Norscan Giant units
Ancient echoes stir in the marrow of the earth. The giants hear — and they answer with fury ands tomped ground.

A single polished eye-stone, cold to the touch and veined like a glacier, said to have fallen from the skull of the first giant ever slain by man — or so the skalds sing. Yngve Aarseth found it embedded in a troll mound, and since then, no Norscan giant has raised its fist in anger toward him. Instead, they stand straighter when he draws near, their brows furrowed as if in reverence… or confusion. Some whisper that the Eye doesn’t merely remind the giants of the past — it allows them to see through it.
